title: Brady, Patriots hold off Colts
text:
Brady, Patriots hold off Colts 
By Dean Pantazi - 21 Alive Indianapolis Colts October 19, 2015 Updated Oct 19, 2015 at 12:04 AM EDT 
INDIANAPOLIS, Ind. (21 Alive) - Tom Brady did it to the Colts again Sunday night with three touchdown passes to lead the New England Patriots to a 34-27 win in Indianapolis. 
Two of Andrew Luck's three touchdown passes and a Mike Adams 14 yard interception return for a touchdown had the Colts in front 21-20 at the half, but Brady hit scoring passes to Rob Gronkowski and LeGarrette Blount in the second half to bring New England back in front. 
The Patriots are now 5-0, the Colts 3-3.   To submit a comment on this article, your email address is required. We respect your privacy and your email will not be visible to others nor will it be added to any email lists. Most Viewed
